intro: Pinalia andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman pinalia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
